intro: Chiliotrichum amelloideum, commonly known as the dwarf bluebell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters and thrives in well-drained soil and partial shade. It produces capsule fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Chiliotrichum amelloideum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
